org.apache.hadoop.util

Class NativeCrc32

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.util.NativeCrc32

  •  class NativeCrc32
extends Object
    Wrapper around JNI support code to do checksum computation natively.

    • Method Detail

      • isAvailable

        public static boolean isAvailable()
        Return true if the JNI-based native CRC extensions are available.

      • verifyChunkedSums

        public static void verifyChunkedSums(int bytesPerSum,
                     int checksumType,
                     ByteBuffer sums,
                     ByteBuffer data,
                     String fileName,
                     long basePos)
                              throws ChecksumException
        Verify the given buffers of data and checksums, and throw an exception if any checksum is invalid. The buffers given to this function should have their position initially at the start of the data, and their limit set at the end of the data. The position, limit, and mark are not modified.
        Parameters:
        bytesPerSum - the chunk size (eg 512 bytes)
        checksumType - the DataChecksum type constant (NULL is not supported)
        sums - the DirectByteBuffer pointing at the beginning of the stored checksums
        data - the DirectByteBuffer pointing at the beginning of the data to check
        basePos - the position in the file where the data buffer starts
        fileName - the name of the file being verified
        Throws:
        ChecksumException - if there is an invalid checksum

      • verifyChunkedSumsByteArray

        public static void verifyChunkedSumsByteArray(int bytesPerSum,
                              int checksumType,
                              byte[] sums,
                              int sumsOffset,

                              int dataOffset,
                              int dataLength,
                              String fileName,
                              long basePos)
                                       throws ChecksumException
        Throws:

      • nativeVerifyChunkedSums

        @Deprecated
static void nativeVerifyChunkedSums(int bytesPerSum,
                                      int checksumType,
                                      ByteBuffer sums,
                                      int sumsOffset,
                                      ByteBuffer data,
                                      int dataOffset,
                                      int dataLength,
                                      String fileName,
                                      long basePos)
                             throws ChecksumException
        Deprecated. use nativeComputeChunkedSums(int, int, ByteBuffer, int, ByteBuffer, int, int, String, long, boolean) instead
        Verify the given buffers of data and checksums, and throw an exception if any checksum is invalid. The buffers given to this function should have their position initially at the start of the data, and their limit set at the end of the data. The position, limit, and mark are not modified. This method is retained only for backwards-compatibility with prior jar versions that need the corresponding JNI function.
        Parameters:
        bytesPerSum - the chunk size (eg 512 bytes)
        checksumType - the DataChecksum type constant
        sums - the DirectByteBuffer pointing at the beginning of the stored checksums
        sumsOffset - start offset in sums buffer
        data - the DirectByteBuffer pointing at the beginning of the data to check
        dataOffset - start offset in data buffer
        dataLength - length of data buffer
        fileName - the name of the file being verified
        basePos - the position in the file where the data buffer starts
        Throws:
        ChecksumException - if there is an invalid checksum

      • nativeComputeChunkedSums
